statutoryBodies.name: Technical Advisory Council on Human Tissue Transplantation
statutoryBodies.statusNote: Established by Section 20. Advisory body to the Minister on administration and implementation of the Act. Not a body corporate — purely advisory. Chaired by Director-General of Health Services. The Council regulates its own meeting procedure (S.20(9)).

exOfficio.role: Deputy Director-General of Health Services (Laboratory Services)

exOfficio.note: Another medical officer holding similar position (S.20(1)(e))

appointed.role: Medical consultants in surgery and general medicine
appointed.note: Appointed by Minister; number at Minister's discretion (S.20(2))

composition.termLength: 3 years (appointed members); ex-officio serve while holding posts

powers: Advise the Minister on the administration and implementation of the Act (S.21)
dataGaps: Current membership of the Council not publicly documented
Number of appointed medical consultants unknown — at Minister's discretion
No publicly available meeting records or minutes

timeline.event: Transplantation of Human Tissues Act enacted
timeline.details: Enacted as Act No. 48 of 1987. Provides the legal framework for removal and transplantation of human tissues and organs, defines brain death, creates consent framework for post-mortem and living donations, and prohibits commercialisation of human tissues.

The Technical Advisory Council on Human Tissue Transplantation was constituted under Section 20. Advisory body chaired by Director-General of Health Services with 5 ex-officio members and Minister-appointed medical consultants.

tiers.name: Minister
tiers.relationship: Policy authority: makes regulations (S.19), appoints Advisory Council members (S.20(2)), may authorise sale of human tissues in writing (S.17(2)), receives advice from Advisory Council (S.21)

tiers.name: Director-General of Health Services
tiers.relationship: Dual role: Chairman of Advisory Council (S.20(1)(a)) and gatekeeper for living non-regenerative tissue donations — must give written authority (S.7(b)); may authorise prescribed officers for post-mortem tissue removal (S.3(1))

tiers.name: Technical Advisory Council
tiers.relationship: Advisory body (S.20-21): advises the Minister on administration and implementation; 5 ex-officio members plus Minister-appointed medical consultants; quorum 3; regulates own procedure

tiers.name: Medical Practitioners / Technicians
tiers.relationship: Carry out tissue removal and transplantation: must be registered medical practitioners (S.23 — Medical Ordinance definition); independent Medical Consultant must certify fitness for living donations (S.7(c)); certifying doctor cannot participate in transplantation (S.16)

tiers.name: Donors / Recipients
tiers.relationship: Protected parties: consent framework (S.2-8); identity confidentiality (S.18); living donors must be age 21+, of sound mind, give free consent (S.7); regenerative tissue living donation restricted to family members (S.8)

currentReplacement.national: Director-General of Health Services exercises primary regulatory authority; Technical Advisory Council provides advice to Minister
currentReplacement.provincial: Not applicable — transplantation regulation is a national function
